summary: This bill, the "Preventing Abusive Routine Tax Nonsense Enabled by Rip-offs Shelters and Havens and Instead Promoting Simplicity Act" (PARTNERSHIPS Act), aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, primarily focusing on partnerships. It revises rules around partner distributive shares, allocation of built-in gains, revalued property, and partnership debt. Key changes include modifications to how net investment income is taxed for high-income individuals, rules for transfers to swap funds, and codifying anti-abuse regulations. The bill also includes provisions on partnership terminations, basis adjustments, and reporting requirements.
